column1: table 5.  Total direct and intergovernmental expenditure, by activity and level of government, fiscal years 1980-99
data source:  Criminal Justice Expenditure and Employment Extracts Program (CJEE)
Table 5.  Total direct and intergovernmental expenditure, by activity and level of government, fiscal years 1980-99
Source:  Justice Expenditure and Employment Extracts, Tables 1 and 4
Notes: Detail may not add to total because of rounding.
Duplicative transactions between levels of governments are excluded from
the total for all governments, the State and local total, and the local total.  Such
intergovernmental expenditure consists of payments from one government
to another and eventually will show up as a direct expenditure of a recipient government.
* Federal government figures presented for 1998 are directly from the
Budget of the United States, using the definitions of justice functions
contained in the Budget.  Prior to 1998 the Census Bureau performed
an extensive compilation of the Federal budget for the purposes of
making the data fit the definitions used in the Census Bureau's surveys
of government finances and public employment.  Therefore "all governments"
and "Federal government" expenditure data prior to 1998 are not directly
comparable to those reported for 1998 and subsequent years.
